reviewText:
It was not what I expected...it was entertaining
Keith
love james garner
James Garner as a really believable Mark Twain
Love this movie.
I wish they had closed captioning due to my poor hearing.  other wise a good program
Arrived timely and enjoyed it as promised by a friend!

I normally love things from this genre.  And I absolutely love James Garner in anything.  But this one took a long time to get started.  It was good once it finally kicked in to the story.  Worth watching through to the end.
good movie
James Garner is Mark Twain telling a story of his younger days.  A different actor plays the younger Mark Twain.
Excellent story -- well-acted and fun to see. Hallmark at its best.

This is a wonderful movie, with gentle humor that is family-friendly....One scene, in particular (Semi-spoiler alert!) is where he runs into a man waiting for his wife to return home- I will not say any more about it- but this one vignette gives me hope for this silly race of ours.  Garner is great, as always.  Worth every penny!
good movie loved the actor
I am looking forward to see this movie,thanks.

My husband and I really enjoyed watching this DVD.  Always appreciative of Samuel Clemens we learned much about his life before he became a noted author and added to understanding the man behind the pen.
My husband and I enjoyed this hilarious tale.  We wondered at the first night and second night labels, but we did take two evenings to watch it.

Movie is awesome, watched once as a kid over 10 years ago, never found a downloadable version online, not even in iTunes. However this does not have a subtitle which is what I really need to have.

Please indicate this info. on the page.
If you are a fan of James Garner, you will enjoy it.
Good
Great cast and great story. Well worth watching.

Sometimes it's hard to see a rating, not this time, I couldn't wait to click on the 5.  This movie sneaks up on you, not knowing what to think.  But we who persevered found joy, knowledge (if you didn't already have it), and plain old reality of life.  The truths in this movie are just that.  I'm 70 now, and I do have some wisdom, so I've been told.  This is a great movie, great acting, great story about a great story teller.  How can you not love it.

Watching this after losing much Under-appreciated actor and Man, Mr. James "Jim" Garner, who both Julie Andrews and Sally Fields said was the best actor they Ever Kissed, I can only say he pulled off the Great Mark Twain/Samuel Clemens Wonderfully!  I had to read the book after the movie and truthfully can't say which I enjoyed more.....sadly Mr. Garner never got the acclaim of Mark Twain....but he nailed him in this great movie for gee  FAMILIES!
An excellent version of Sam Clement's book.
nice movie
Fun to watch having read the book, but no spectacular views of Nevada that we expected to see.

Classic Mark Twain tall-tale humor. I recommend it for parents to share with childre/adolescents because it gives good advice to youngsters without lecturing them--even though the setting is a lecture to young women.
Great price , as described.
Well done!
Great movie
